rules.natural: Either the research team discovers an ancient relic, or they do not have government grant funding
The research team either identifies ceramic fragments among the materials or identifies metal objects among the materials
Should the research team identify metal objects among the materials, then they complete their research within the time period
When the research team documents findings in the field journal, then they preserve the excavation site
Under the condition that identifying ceramic fragments does not lead to documenting findings, then the research team halts the excavation
Given that identifying ceramic fragments does not result in documenting findings, then the research team does not halt the excavation
If the research team does not complete their research within the time period, then they have government grant funding

facts.natural: The research team does not discover an ancient relic
The research team does not preserve the excavation site

target.natural: The research team completes their research within the time period

steps.natural: The research team does not have government grant funding
The research team completes their research within the time period
Provided that the research team identifies ceramic fragments among the materials, then they document findings in the field journal
If the research team identifies ceramic fragments among the materials, then they preserve the excavation site
Either the research team preserves the excavation site, or they complete their research within the time period
The research team completes their research within the time period

natural_facts.A1: The research team has government grant funding
natural_facts.A2: The research team discovers an ancient relic
natural_facts.A3: The research team preserves the excavation site
natural_facts.A4: The research team identifies ceramic fragments among the materials
natural_facts.A5: The research team identifies metal objects among the materials
natural_facts.A6: The research team documents findings in the field journal
natural_facts.A7: The research team halts the excavation
natural_facts.G: The research team completes their research within the time period

The research team does not preserve the excavation site

(A2 ∨ ¬A1).natural: Either the research team discovers an ancient relic, or they do not have government grant funding

(A3 ∨ G).natural: Either the research team preserves the excavation site, or they complete their research within the time period

(A4 → A3).natural: If the research team identifies ceramic fragments among the materials, then they preserve the excavation site

(A4 → A6).natural: Provided that the research team identifies ceramic fragments among the materials, then they document findings in the field journal

(A4 ∨ A5).natural: The research team either identifies ceramic fragments among the materials or identifies metal objects among the materials

(A5 → G).natural: Should the research team identify metal objects among the materials, then they complete their research within the time period

(A6 → A3).natural: When the research team documents findings in the field journal, then they preserve the excavation site

(¬(A4 → A6) → A7).natural: Under the condition that identifying ceramic fragments does not lead to documenting findings, then the research team halts the excavation

(¬(A4 → A6) → ¬A7).natural: Given that identifying ceramic fragments does not result in documenting findings, then the research team does not halt the excavation

(¬G → A1).natural: If the research team does not complete their research within the time period, then they have government grant funding

G.natural: The research team completes their research within the time period

¬A1.natural: The research team does not have government grant funding

¬A2.natural: The research team does not discover an ancient relic

¬A3.natural: The research team does not preserve the excavation site
